conclusion: Understanding how shadow position and size change with light source movement is key.
Shadow A is positioned to the left and slightly behind the lamp.
As the light source moves forward, shadow A will move and potentially change in size.
Shadow B is positioned to the right and slightly behind the pastry.
As the light source moves forward, shadow B will move and potentially change in size.
Shadow C is positioned to the left and slightly in front of the cake.
As the light source moves forward, shadow C will move and potentially change in size.
Shadow D is positioned to the right and slightly in front of the cupcake.
As the light source moves forward, shadow D will move and potentially change in size.
Moving the light source forward decreases the angle of light, causing shadows to become longer and more spread out.
Shadow A will move further to the left and become longer.
Shadow B will move further to the right and become longer.
Shadow C will move further to the left and become longer.
Shadow D will move further to the right and become longer.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will all move further away from the objects and become longer.
